required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Effectiveness and Safety of Radiesse for the Correction of Moderate to Severe Nasolabial Folds
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Effectiveness and Safety of Radiesse for the Correction of Moderate to Severe Nasolabial Folds

brief_summary.textblock:
Effectiveness: The purpose of this study is to demonstrate the non-inferiority of Radiesse (CaHA) to Restylane (HA) following subdermal implantation for the correction of moderate to severe facial wrinkles and folds, such as NLFs.
Safety: To evaluate the incidence and type of adverse events and serious adverse events.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline to Week 24 on the Wrinkle Severity Rating Scale (WSRS)
primary_outcome.description: The Wrinkle Severity Rating Scale (WSRS) is a 5-point scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects with improvement on the Investigator Global Aesthetic Improvement Scale (iGAIS) for each NLF at Week 24
Proportion of subjects with any improvement on the Subject Global Aesthetic Improvement Scale (sGAIS) for each NLF at Week 24
Incidence of treatment-emergent adverse events related to Radiesse

clinical_study.condition: Correction of Moderate to Severe Nasolabial Folds (NLFs)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Left side Radiesse® / Right side Restylane®
Left side Restylane® / Right side Radiesse®

intervention.arm_group_label: Left side Radiesse® / Right side Restylane®
Left side Restylane® / Right side Radiesse®
intervention.other_name: Calcium hydroxylapatite particles suspended in an aqueous based gel carrier.

intervention.arm_group_label: Left side Radiesse® / Right side Restylane®
Left side Restylane® / Right side Radiesse®

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Has symmetrical NLFs, with the same WSRS score of 3 or 4 (moderate or severe) for both right and left NLFs, as determined on live assessment by the blinded evaluator.
- Is ≥ 22 and ≤ 65 years of age.
- Is willing to abstain from all other aesthetic treatments on any part of the face, including but not limited to injectable fillers, implants, neurotoxin, skin peels, laser treatments, surgical treatments, etc. for the trial's duration.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Has an acute inflammatory process or active infection at the injection site.
- Has received mid- and/or lower-facial region treatments with any dermal fillers.
- Has received facial dermal therapies.
- Had prior surgery in the mid- and/or lower-facial area, including the NLFs, or has a permanent implant or graft in the mid- and/or lowerfacial area that could interfere with effectiveness assessments.
